ReinforcementBendRules.t1: SP 63.13330.2018 "SNIP 52-01-2003 Concrete and reinforced concrete structures. Basic provisions", clause 10.3.33
ReinforcementBendRules.t2: EN 1992-1-1 "Eurocode 2: Design of concrete structures - Part 1-1 : General rules and rules for buildings", clause 8.3
ReinforcementBendRules.h4: Fix bend diameters for existing types
ReinforcementBendRules.h5: If the option is enabled and the appropriate types of rebars are found during operation, their bend diameters will be checked and corrected according to the selected standards. If this option is disabled, existing rebar types will not be checked and corrected. Blocks must be inserted with this plugin or copy already inserted, otherwise (when inserted by normal means AutoCAD), extended data will not be added!

The "By two point" insert option is available when you select the "Side view" or "Top view" display option. mpSpecifications.Description: Plugin for the formation and filling of general specifications
mpSpecifications.FullDescription: Plugin allows you to add items to the context menu of AutoCAD, allowing you to expand the ability to work with the specifications: Context menu for tables: Add product from the database - allows you to add products from the plugin database directly into the AutoCAD table; Context menu for blocks: Add/change attributes for the specification - allows you to add attributes to the blocks for the specification (see details in the help)

mpDwgBase.r1: The default plugin assumes that the blocks added to the local (user) database will be added to the global database that is available to all users.
mpDwgBase.r2: Therefore, try to follow the recommendations:
mpDwgBase.r3: The added block should be useful in the work. No matter what professional orientation it will be
mpDwgBase.r4: Do not use a wide variety of layers in the blocks, if this is not necessary. The best option is to use the standard layers of the ModPlus plugin
mpDwgBase.r5: If the block is dynamic, then perhaps it is not necessary to add attributes for the specification
mpDwgBase.r6: Let the blocks understandable names and descriptions, so that the user does not have to guess what it is and why
mpDwgBase.r7: If you took a block from some resource, then be sure to specify the source!
mpDwgBase.r8: Do not be lazy to think over the path to the block in the database
mpDwgBase.r10: The default plugin assumes that the drawings added to the local (user) database will be added to the global database, which is accessible to all users.
mpDwgBase.r11: Therefore, some restrictions are added to the attached drawings:
mpDwgBase.r13: In the attached drawing, Proxy primitives should not be used
mpDwgBase.r14: Drawings made in poor quality (for example, with multileaders from lines and text, etc.) will not be taken to the public database
mpDwgBase.r15: Also try to follow the recommendations:
mpDwgBase.r16: Do not use a wide variety of layers in the drawings, if this is not necessary. The best option is to use the standard layers of the ModPlus plugin
mpDwgBase.r17: Do not use a large number of annotation styles in your drawings. The best option is to use the annotations styles of the ModPlus plugin
mpDwgBase.r18: Do not use line types in drawings that are not standard for AutoCAD
mpDwgBase.r19: Do not use fonts that are not part of the standard AutoCAD font set in drawings
mpDwgBase.r20: If you took a drawing from some resource, then be sure to specify the source!
mpDwgBase.r21: Do not be lazy to think over the way to the drawing in the database
mpDwgBase.pp1: It is assumed that you have selected a block in a file that is not yet located in the ModPlus/Data/DwgBase directory. Therefore, you must either specify a file previously created in the ModPlus/Data/DwgBase directory to place blocks in it, or create this file. The selected block will be copied to the specified file.
mpDwgBase.pp2: If you add several blocks with a common orientation (for example, blocks of floor slabs), then create one file for them. You do not need to create a separate file for each block!
mpDwgBase.pp3: Files in the root of the ModPlus/Data/DwgBase folder can not be created! Create subfolders in it (for example, ModPlus/Data/DwgBase/Floor slabs).
mpDwgBase.pp4: If you created a file with blocks, put it in the folder DwgBase and now add blocks from the file to the database, check the "Current file" check box.
mpDwgBase.pp5: The field is filled in according to your wish
mpDwgBase.pp6: P.S. We are very happy for you, if you have an original and beautiful Nick, but try all the same to write Surname and First Name
mpDwgBase.pp7: If you are not the author of the block, then indicate the source from where this block was taken, so as not to offend its creator
mpDwgBase.pp8: The conditional path to the block in the directory that forms the structure of the tree

mprWallsReinforcement.Description: Analysis, grouping and reinforcement according to given conditions of walls and openings
mprWallsReinforcement.FullDescription: Plugin works only with walls located in one level. Plugin analyzes the walls, allowing you to find three types of intersections (corner, end and cross) and openings. Flexible grouping allows you to specify exactly what type of reinforcement should be made. You can perform reinforcement only for the specified groups - walls, intersections or openings. Plugin can work even on an empty template

mprWallsReinforcement.jtd2: Created straight joints of vertical rebars. Overlap length is set from the top of the overlying floor or from the top of the wall. When the width of the overlying wall decreases, the reinforcement is bent (if floor exist)

If the bends of the rebars can not be performed in two directions, the rebars are bent in one direction in different levels of the floor
mprWallsReinforcement.jtd5: Created straight joints of vertical rebars. Overlap length is set from the top of the overlying floor or from the top of the wall
mprWallsReinforcement.jtd6: Straight joints of vertical rebars in the form of a "bottle" are created - the bends are bent to the center of intersection to the diameter of the rebar. The anchoring length is set from the top of the overlying floor or from the top of the wall
mprWallsReinforcement.jtd7: Joints are created in the overlying floor in the form of separate L-shaped bars. The first anchoring length - the length of the anchoring of the rods into the floor - is counted from the side face of the wall. The second anchoring length - the length of the anchoring of the rods into the wall - is counted from the top edge of the wall. If the bends of the rebars can not be performed in two directions, the rebars are bent in one direction in different levels of the floor
mprWallsReinforcement.jtd8: Created straight joints of vertical rebars without taking into account the overlying elements

mprWallsReinforcement.t43: Attention! The surface appearance of the reinforcement may depend on the class of reinforcement, diameter or other values that are not considered by the program. Read the normative documentation
mprWallsReinforcement.t44: α is a coefficient that takes into account the effect on the anchoring length of the stress state of concrete and reinforcement and the structural solution of the element in the anchoring zone. When anchoring rods of a periodic profile with straight ends (straight anchoring) or smooth reinforcement with hooks or loops without additional anchoring devices for stretched rods, take α = 1.0, and for compressed ones - α = 0.75. According to clause 10.3.30 of SP 63.13330, the coefficient α may be increased to 2.0
mprWallsReinforcement.t45: According to paragraph 10.3.8 of SP 63.13330.2012, the vertical bars take no more than 2t and 400 mm (t is the thickness of the wall). The maximum allowable value is calculated based on the smallest wall thickness in the group
mprWallsReinforcement.t46: In accordance with GOST 21.501-2018, clause 6.4.7, the length of the detail is set along the outer edge of the rebar
mprWallsReinforcement.t47: Increases the time of the reinforcement generation!
mprWallsReinforcement.t48: The details of the reinforcement of the intersection will be established with the horizontal reinforcement of the walls - by the smallest or the largest step of horizontal reinforcement of the walls participating in the intersection
mprWallsReinforcement.t49: The number of rows of vertical reinforcement (in a row is two bars "along" the opening)
mprWallsReinforcement.t50: The number of rows of horizontal reinforcement (in a row is two bars "along" the opening)
mprWallsReinforcement.t51: Selecting a foundation plate directly below the selected walls. Foundation plate selection available after wall selection, analysis and grouping. You can select one or more plates. In the properties of the base plates should be included properties "Structural"
mprWallsReinforcement.t52: The maximum allowable value of the binding is calculated from the condition of the minimum allowable distance in the light according to section 10.3.5 of SP 63.13330 for the smallest wall width in the group
mprWallsReinforcement.t53: Reset all values ​​of the current default reinforcement settings to the default values ​​set in the plugin
mprWallsReinforcement.t54: Copy the current plate joints reinforcement settings to all selected plates
mprWallsReinforcement.t55: Save the current plate joints reinforcement settings to the xml file
mprWallsReinforcement.t56: Load the joints reinforcement settings from the xml file and set for the current plate
mprWallsReinforcement.t57: The minimum and maximum values ​​are calculated based on the specified diameters and vertical reinforcement step
mprWallsReinforcement.t58: Rebar length consists of two anchoring lengths
mprWallsReinforcement.t59: When you turn on the "Breaking in" option, each first pair of joints along the wall will be created with the first anchoring length, every second pair - with the second anchoring length
mprWallsReinforcement.t60: If the joints exceed the height of the overlying wall, they will be cut off along the upper face of the wall, taking into account the specified ends cover of the rebars
mprWallsReinforcement.t61: The selection variant applies to the selection of foundation plates
mprWallsReinforcement.t62: The vertical rebar is moved to the place where the U-shaped rebar bend begins, which is obtained by adding the values of the cover layer of the horizontal reinforcement from the ends, the diameter of the U-shaped rebar and the standard bending diameter of the U-shaped rebar
mprWallsReinforcement.t63: You can specify preferred rebar shapes for different types of rebars created by the plugin.
mprWallsReinforcement.t64: Setting the preferred shapes does not guarantee that the reinforcement will be created using the specified shape of the rebar.
mprWallsReinforcement.t65: When creating rebars, an attempt will be made to use the specified shape. If creating a rebar with the specified shape is not possible, Revit will automatically search for a suitable shape or create a new shape.
mprWallsReinforcement.t66: Save current reinforcement settings as default reinforcement settings
mprWallsReinforcement.t67: Group walls, intersections and openings according to the current grouping settings
mprWallsReinforcement.t68: When this option is enabled, stirrups will not be created at intersections of walls and at the ends of walls where details are created (for example, U-shaped details)
mprWallsReinforcement.t69: If the horizontal bars of the background reinforcement are on the inside and the vertical bars are on the outside, it is recommended to specify the girth of the vertical bars. For the opposite case, when the horizontal bars of the background reinforcement are located outside, it is recommended to specify the girth of the horizontal bars
mprWallsReinforcement.t70: The length of the detail is taken as the length of the anchoring

mrBatchSheetExport.Description: Plugin allows you to export all specified sheets to dwg/dxf

mmOrderMarking.Description: Adding numbering to the specified parameter of elements with the possibility of numbering in the schedules
mmOrderMarking.FullDescription: When working in a non-schedule view, you can specify the direction of numbering based on the arrangement of elements, or add numbering in the order in which elements were created. When working in a schedule, the plugin adds numbering in the order of items in the schedule (taking into account sorting). The schedule property "Itemized every instance" affects the speed of the plugin. It is possible to set the prefix and suffix for the number
mmOrderMarking.h10: Search (enter * to display only selected items)
mmOrderMarking.h15: has the "Read Only" property for the following elements
mmOrderMarking.h16: It is not possible to change the instance parameter for an element located in a group if the parameter "Values ​​can vary by group instances" is not enabled for the parameter or it is not the "Mark" system parameter
mmOrderMarking.h17: Errors occurred while changing the parameter values ​​of the listed items
mmOrderMarking.h18: Attention! The parameter is cleared for all elements of this schedule, regardless of the filtering settings. This means that if, for example, 10 columns are presented in the schedule, and only 5 columns are displayed in the filter settings, then the parameter will be cleared for all 10 columns! Clear parameter?
mmOrderMarking.t1: The work of the plugin is possible only in the schedule in the sorting settings of which the property "Itemize every instance" is checked
mmOrderMarking.t3: Standard frame selection - selection of elements in the current view with a frame with confirmation of the selection by pressing the "Finish" button. With this option, the numbering direction has five options - in the order of creation and by the position of the elements.
mmOrderMarking.t4: Ordinal selection - selects each element for numbering in the order in which the numbering will be performed. With this option, the direction of numbering can be ascending or descending. Completion of the selection is invoked by pressing the Esc key.
mmOrderMarking.t5: Curve intersection - Select a curve (model line or detail line). The elements for numbering will be selected by finding the intersection of the curve with the geometry of the elements in the current view, projected onto the plane of the view. With this option, the direction of numbering can be ascending or descending.
mmOrderMarking.t6: For all selection variants elements can filter by category both before and after elements selection.
mmOrderMarking.t7: The list of parameters is filled in after selecting the elements for numbering.
mmOrderMarking.m2: No items on current view schedule
mmOrderMarking.m3: Filter selected elements by the current list of categories?
mmOrderMarking.d2: Left to right and top to bottom
mmOrderMarking.d3: Left to right and bottom to top
mmOrderMarking.d4: Right to left and top to bottom
mmOrderMarking.d5: Right to left and bottom to top

mprColumnsReinforcement.Description: Analysis, grouping and reinforcement of columns for specified conditions
mprColumnsReinforcement.FullDescription: Plugin allows you to process both individually selected columns and all columns in a view or in a document. Reinforcement is carried out taking into account the relative position of the columns above each other. Transverse reinforcement can be assembled using a variety of rebar shape options. Plugin can work even on an empty template

mprSheetRenumber.Description: Plugin allows to renumber sheets in the project
mprSheetRenumber.FullDescription: Renumbering of sheets is carried out within one group of sheets. You can display all sheets by analogy with the current settings of the project manager or display all sheets in one group. There is an opportunity to change the position of sheets by moving them in the group, while maintaining the initial numbering of sheets in this group

mprSheetRenumber.m2: Available in the full version of the plugin

mprSheetRenumber.h15: Renumber sheets in a group according to the specified settings
mprSheetRenumber.h16: Renumbering by moving allows you to swap sheets in the group, while maintaining the original numbering in the group
mprSheetRenumber.h17: Extended numbering settings for a group
mprSheetRenumber.h18: You can create a scheme for the numbers of sheets using the three configurable parts and dividers between them. In each part, you can specify the prefix, suffix and number. The number can be made static or dynamic (increasing or decreasing). The whole sheet number, part or part number can be written to the specified parameter

mprPatterns.Description: Fill patterns manager with the ability to import, export, edit and create

mprSlabsReinforcement.Description: Analysis, grouping and reinforcement of slabs for specified conditions
mprSlabsReinforcement.FullDescription: Plugin allows you to process both individually selected slabs, and all slabs in the view or in the document. The main reinforcement of the slab can be performed as separate rebars, or area reinforcement. The analysis of holes is made from the geometry of the slab itself and does not depend on the used families. Plugin can work even on an empty template

mprSlabsReinforcement.t1: According to SP 63.13330.2012, p. 10.3.5 - the minimum distance in the light between the rebars should be at least the largest diameter of the rod, as well as at least 25 mm for the lower reinforcement and 30 mm for the upper reinforcement; p. 10.3.8 - the largest distance between the axes of the rods should not be more than 200 mm with a plate cross-section height h <= 150 mm and no more than 1,5h and 400 mm with a cross-section height h> 150 mm
mprSlabsReinforcement.t2: Check and offset when hit on the rods of the background reinforcement is made for the first (nearest) rod, which does not guarantee the correct displacement of the second or third rod. The minimum permissible distance between the rods in the light is taken into account - 30 mm
mprSlabsReinforcement.t3: The reinforcement previously created by the plugin is deleted depending on the newly created reinforcement. For example, if you choose to create only the main (background) reinforcement, then previously created U-shaped rods along the contour of the slab will not be deleted
mprSlabsReinforcement.t4: Save current reinforcement settings as default reinforcement settings
mprSlabsReinforcement.t5: If the option is enabled, then the upper and lower rebar cover will be applied when creating background reinforcement meshes, without taking into account the diameters of other reinforcement. If the option is disabled, the rebar cover will be applied for all types of reinforcement being created, and the position of the background reinforcement meshes relative to the upper and lower faces of the slab will be calculated from the established conditions
mprSlabsReinforcement.t6: U-shaped rods will be created with the rod step of the upper mesh of the background reinforcement. If the background reinforcement is not created in the plate, the U-shaped rods will be created with the specified step

mprSlabsReinforcement.t43: Attention! The surface appearance of the reinforcement may depend on the class of reinforcement, diameter or other values that are not considered by the program. Read the normative documentation
mprSlabsReinforcement.t44: α is a coefficient that takes into account the effect on the anchoring length of the stress state of concrete and reinforcement and the structural solution of the element in the anchoring zone. When anchoring rods of a periodic profile with straight ends (straight anchoring) or smooth reinforcement with hooks or loops without additional anchoring devices for stretched rods, take α = 1.0, and for compressed ones - α = 0.75.
mprSlabsReinforcement.t46: In accordance with GOST 21.501-2018, clause 6.4.7, the length of the detail is set along the outer edge of the rebar
mprSlabsReinforcement.t47: The length of the detail is taken as the length of the anchoring

mprSlabsReinforcement.t65: When creating rebars, an attempt will be made to use the specified shape. If creating a rebar with the specified shape is not possible, Revit will automatically search for a suitable shape or create a new shape.

In this case, the plugin will automatically add items to the list of processed

mrSearchBy.Description: Search for objects by various conditions
mrSearchBy.FullDescription: Plugin allows you to search by properties, parameters and quantities among all objects of the model or objects of the specified type. Found objects are highlighted in the model. There is an opportunity in the search bar to specify several values for the search, indicate the “AND-OR” operation option, and also use the “not equal”, “less”, “more” operators
mrSearchBy.h9: Reset current selection if nothing is found
mrSearchBy.t1: Indicate in what units of values from the objects will be taken, and the accuracy of comparing the numerical values
mrSearchBy.t2: Specify a match option for string values: whether the string to be checked must match the search value completely or the string to be checked may contain the search value
mrSearchBy.t3: You can specify multiple values for the search by separating them with an asterisk. For example, “200*300”.
mrSearchBy.t4: If several values are specified, the “OR” option will work. For example, when searching by the value “200*300”, a match of “200” or “300” will be satisfactory.
mrSearchBy.t5: To use the “AND” option, specify “AND” at the beginning of the search query. For example, “AND200*300” indicates that the value “200” and the value “300” must match in the searched object.
mrSearchBy.t6: When specifying fractional numbers, the separator of the integer and fractional part set in the regional settings of the operating system is taken into account. If you use a comma in the settings, then the value "1.75" will be processed as a string.
mrSearchBy.t7: To search by “Yes/No” parameters, “true” or “false” should be indicated in the search bar, respectively.
mrSearchBy.t8: For numerical values, you can specify comparison operators: “! =” Is not equal, “<” is less, “>” is more. For string values, you can specify the comparison operator "! =" (Not equal), which is processed only if the value "Equal" is selected in the "Match string type" property.
mrSearchBy.t9: For example, the string “ANDConcrete*> 1,75” indicates that you need to find objects that have the string value “Concrete” and a numerical value greater than 1,75 among the values to be checked.
mrSearchBy.t10: You can specify the specific name of the property or parameter in which you want to validate the entered value. For example, the string “Note=Concrete” with the “Search in properties” checkbox selected indicates that objects matching the search condition should have the “Note” property with the value “Concrete”. Name validation is also handled based on the “String Match Type”.
mrSearchBy.t11: To search by the condition of empty values, you need to specify only the name of the property or parameter. For example, the line “Note=” with the checkbox “Search in properties” checked, indicates that objects satisfying the search condition should have the property “Note” with an empty value.
mrSearchBy.t12: Checking all string values is not case sensitive.
mrSearchBy.t13: Show found objects on a 3D scene

mprContextFilter.Description: Filter elements by parameters, which works as a context menu
mprContextFilter.FullDescription: The filter is launched in one of three ways: by left-clicking the mouse while holding down the Ctrl key, by sequential pressing of keys, or by pressing a key combination. The filter has three processing levels - all elements of the model, elements in the current view, or selected elements. There is the ability to use presets for quick filter use.

In this case, there may be some restrictions on working in Revit associated with the use of this combination of buttons. For example, when you try to add other elements to the set of selected items
mprContextFilter.h26: The context filter dialog is called by successive pressing of the indicated keys. The default sequence is “F, F”. The time interval between keystrokes is not taken into account. When specifying a sequence, consider the assigned Revit hotkeys
mprContextFilter.h27: The context filter dialog is called by pressing the specified key combination. The default key combination is “Shift + F”. When specifying a different combination, consider existing combinations (Ctrl + C, Ctrl + V and others)
